place.name: CAMELEY
place.gazetteerText: CAMELEY, a parish in Clutton district, Somerset; 5½ miles WNW of Radstock r. station. It contains Temple Cloud village, with post office under Bristol. Acres, 1,633. Real property, £3,808. Pop., 526. Houses, 102. Bath stone is quarried. The living is a rectory in the diocese of Bath and Wells. Value, £256.* Patron, J. Hippisley, Esq. The church is ancient. There are a national school and charities £21. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
